package.name: blat

actions.action: export HOME=$INSTALL_DIR && mkdir -p $HOME/bin/`uname -m` && make MACHTYPE=`uname -m` && mv $INSTALL_DIR/bin/`uname -m`/* $INSTALL_DIR/bin/ && rm $INSTALL_DIR/.ccache/ -rf

package.readme:
BLAT sequence aligner from the UCSC: http://genome.ucsc.edu/FAQ/FAQblat.html Git development repository: http://genome-source.cse.ucsc.edu/gitweb/?p=kent.git
This reporsitory contains the following binaries: - blat - faToNib - faToTwoBit - gfClient - gfServer - nibFrag - pslPretty - pslReps - pslSort - twoBitInfo - twoBitToFa
Please note that the BLAT source and executables are freely available for academic, nonprofit and personal use. Commercial licensing information is available on the Kent Informatics website (http://www.kentinformatics.com/).
